The Boxer (non-MR)
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Poetry: The Boxer (non-MR)
By CHB on Saturday, January 31, 2004 - 09:13 pm:

-I posted the MR conversion of this before, but I figured I might as well go ahead and post the original. Based on a match I previously had-


In this fate, I'm left to wonder,
is this my demise?
This shadow that does mock and lumber,
beyond my blackened eyes.

A painful thought that comes with blur,
against my now clinched teeth.
My mind is shattered of what were,
as the mat I haste to meet.

I feel the voices, a rumble now,
with my cheek against the floor,
and with this, I rise somehow,
how could they ask for more?

I shake it off, or attempt at so,
as I mix the blood and sweat.
The man in the corner may never know,
why I haven't given up yet.

I hear the bell as we resume,
echoes of a thousand rings.
A rhythmic stride and I'm consumed,
by my gloves' request to sing.

End of the day, and I walk home,
staggering in the moon lit night.
Despite all the talent I had shown,
it was still one hell of a fight.

My head now thumbs and throbs,
as the cuts continue to sting,
the bruises slightly make me sob,
who knew pain was such a fiend?

My left hand loosely grips my right,
sore for paying this cost,
but nothing builds success up quite,
as such an extravagant loss.

By Icelord13 on Saturday, January 31, 2004 - 09:40 pm:

A very nice poem. I liked the absolute meaning and the flow of it. nice job!

By Infernus on Saturday, January 31, 2004 - 10:52 pm:

Nice. Really, very nice. I can only comment on one thing.

My head now thumbs and throbs,
as the cuts continue to sting,
the bruises slightly make me sob,
who knew pain was such a fiend?

I would suggest fixing this part. I have suggestions on what to use for the line, but I won't say them unless you ask me to. If you don't want to change it, I can't force you, but I think changing the last line in that stanza specifically would improve the poem. That's just my opinion.

Still, very nice. It almost makes me feel as if my jaw is sore from getting a hard right to it.

By CHB on Saturday, January 31, 2004 - 11:03 pm:

Good eye, Infernus, since that line was added.

If you read the poem without that section, it almost tosses the rhyme scheme off.

*End of the day, and I walk home,
staggering in the moon lit night.
Despite all the talent I had shown,
it was still one hell of a fight.

My left hand loosely grips my right,
sore for paying this cost,
but nothing builds success up quite,
as such an extravagant loss.*

I didn't like having right immediately after fight. So I added one. Good eye, though.

By CHB on Sunday, February 1, 2004 - 12:00 am:

Change:

My head now thumps and throbs,
as the cuts continue to sting,
the bruises slightly make me sob,
in my head the bells still rings.

Thanks to Infernus for grammatical update.
